verse: This is what the Lord God showed me: Look! He was forming locust swarms as the latter plantings were just beginning to sprout. Indeed, the king had just taken his first fruit tax.
And so it came about that when the swarm had finished eating the grass of the land, I was saying,
So the Lord relented from this. “This will not happen,” said the Lord.
This is what the Lord God showed me: Look! The Lord God was calling for judgment by fire, and it was drying up the great depths of the ocean and consuming the land.
So the Lord relented from this. “This will not happen, either,” said the Lord God.

header: The Vision of the Plumb Line

verse: This is what he showed me: Look! The Lord was standing upon a wall that stood straight and true, with a plumb line in his hand.
And the Lord was asking me, “What do you see, Amos?”

So Amaziah priest of Bethel sent a message to Jeroboam king of Israel. It said, “Amos has been conspiring against you in the very heart of the house of Israel! The land cannot bear everything he has to say,
So Amaziah kept saying to Amos, “Get out of here, you seer! Go back to the land of Judah. Live there and prophesy there.
Don’t prophesy anymore at Bethel, because it’s the king’s sanctuary and a temple of the kingdom.”
Amos replied in answer to Amaziah,
But the Lord took me from tending the flock and the Lord kept saying to me, ‘Go, prophesy to my people Israel.’
“Very well then, hear this message from the Lord:
